subject: Travel
title: Coral Reef Restoration
description: A quick win: understand Coral Reef Restoration.

hook.text: Scientists are planting coral like farmers plant crops, growing fragments on underwater nursery trees.

buildup.text: Coral reefs support 25% of all marine species but cover less than 1% of the ocean floor.

discovery.text: A single coral nursery can produce 40,000 fragments per year. Divers glue them onto dead reefs.

twist.text: Labs are breeding 'super coral' that resists heat. Some strains survive temperatures that kill natural coral.

climax.text: In Florida, restored reefs are already attracting fish back to areas that were barren for years.

punchline.text: We broke the reefs. Now we're learning to grow them back.

quiz.question: What is 'super coral'?
options: Lab-bred coral that resists higher temperatures
